required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Follow-Up of the Prevision® Hip Stem
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Follow-Up of the Prevision® Hip Stem in a Consecutive Case Series

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to represent the treatment reality at the study site and to draw conclusions from cases of failure or suboptimal outcome. Potential risk factors for revision surgery, suboptimal outcome or radiologic sign of loosening, bone non-union or stem subsidence will be evaluated. Next to the functional outcome, stem subsidence will be used as an important indicator for a stable fixation of the revision stem.

primary_outcome.measure: Hip stem survival measured by Kaplan-Meier
primary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of the study is hip stem survival, which is a common indicator for implant performance, which can also be used for comparison with implant registry data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The Oxford Hip Score is a 12-item questionnaire that assesses hip function and pain. The score ranges between 12 and 60, with a lower score indicating less disability

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction with their endoprosthetic revision treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The Patients are asked to grade their level of satisfaction with the outcome of the surgery at time of follow-up, with the grades: "very dissatisfied", "dissatisfied", "satisfied", "very satisfied". The grades may be summarized as "satisfied" vs. "dissatisfied".

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Union of the osteotomy o Healing of the fracture and of the greater trochanter, if applicable

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Distal and proximal radiographic bone ingrowth and Qualitative proximal remodeling

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Signs of radiographic loosening in the distal fixation zone

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Stem subsidence from ap x-rays using landmarks of the femur (typically lesser trochanter) and of the prosthesis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Discrepancy of leg length is often considered to be a problem after total hip replacement and can adversely affect an otherwise excellent outcome and may be associated with patient dissatisfaction.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
secondary_outcome.description: (Serious) adverse events that are potentially related to the Total hip arthroplasty (THA) procedure or the THA implants will be recorded. These are events as reported by the patient, observed in the follow-up examinations or taken from the patient record

other_outcome.time_frame: One scheduled Follow-Up visit per patient, 2-7 years after initial implantation
other_outcome.description: Age, weight, gender, date of surgery, indication for revision, comorbidities, intraoperative details

clinical_study.condition: Periprosthetic Fracture Around Prosthetic Joint Implant

study_pop.textblock: All patients were implanted 2-7 year before the start of the retrospective study activities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients implanted with a Prevision® hip stem at the study site between 2014 and 2019
- Written informed patient consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients < 18 years at surgery

facility.name: Caritas-Krankenhaus Bad Mergentheim, Klinik für Orthopädie und Unfallchirurgie
